Or "The author of this chapter is using the FireRed/LeafGreen version of Sabrina because they think she looks cooler that way!"

But try as you might, the blue energy still surrounded you, and you could only move your head. Without warning, the angered giantess...
11233.title: Eye think that was a bad decision.

choices: "Clean my boots. I want to see them shine."
"Give me a massage. It's been a long day and I want to relax."
112331.content:
Sabrina used her psychic powers to pull your from the dollhouse and lift you up before her face. With one of her gloved hands still covering her injured eye, she glared at you in a way that made it abundantly clear that you had just made a terrible mistake.

"Why did you do that? I did nothing to provoke such an attack. What could have possibly made you think that that was an appropriate course of action?" Sabrina asked, her enraged scowl slowly calming down and shifting to a more relaxed but stern gaze.

"I... I'm sorry... I was just scared, I didn't think... I'm sorry..." You mumbled out nervously.

"Scared or not, that was incredibly uncalled for. What did you even think that you were going to accomplish by doing that? So very foolish..." Sabrina said, shaking her head. At this point she didn't even appear to be mad anymore. She seemed to be more disappointed in you than anything.

"I... I'm sorry..." Was all you could say. This entire situation was just so unreal to you, and that combined with the intense fear left your brain completely fried.

"Yes, I get that. That doesn't change the fact that you struck me for absolutely no reason. Now shut up fore a moment and let me think about what to do with you..." Sabrina said.

With that, her eyes glowed bright red and she used her psychic powers to seal your mouth shut. Unable to speak, unable to move, you could do nothing but float there helpless before the face of this psychic giantess as she began to contemplate your fate.

For the next few minutes you were made to wait as Sabrina thought of many possible punishments. With how small you were she could easily kill you, but that would be far to harsh a penalty for what was ultimately a harmless action. Perhaps she could place you inside her boot and force you to endure the rest of the day under her foot? No, there was simply too great a chance of her accidentally crushing you for that to be a viable option. After some time, she finally decided on a simple but effective punishment. One that would be relatively harmless but would still serve to get across the point that she was the one in charge.

"Alright, I've made my decision. You will be my slave for the rest of the day. I will have you do whatever menial tasks I can think of for me, and you will do them without question. If you complete your tasks well, you will earn my favor. However, for each task that you fail to complete, an additional day will be added to your punishment. If you do a good job, this can be over easily and painlessly. Oh, and one more thing. DO NOT attempt to escape. I'll tell you right now, you aren't getting away from me unless I decide to let you go. The only thing running will do is dig yourself into an even deeper hole. Do you understand me?" Sabrina said, releasing the psychic seal on your mouth and allowing you to speak once again.

"Y-yes, I understand." You reply quickly, not wanting to anger this giant psychic any further.

"Very good. And that will be 'yes mistress' for the duration of your punishment, slave." Sabrina said with a satisfied grin.

"Y-yes mistress, of course mistress." You reply, still incredibly nervous. If Sabrina's psychic powers weren't keeping your body locked in place, your would definitely be shaking like a leaf right now.

"Alright then. It's time for your first task. The first thing that I will have you do for me is..."
112331.title: Becoming Sabrina's slave for the day

112332.content:
With fire-red fury radiating from her uninjured eye, the giantess begins to raise her pink boot above your body. You struggle against the strange blue force holding you in place, but you are powerless in her psychic grasp - even when you briefly manage to move a little bit of your own accord, she simply pushes you back into place. The light is blotted out as the giant woman's foot hangs overhead, the sole of her boot giving you a detailed look at all the dirt that has accumulated amongst the treads. You continue to struggle in vain, as the boot lowers down towards you, pinning you between the cold hard floor and her dirty rubber sole. You feel yourself being squeezed tighter and tighter, until...

*

Sabrina scrapes the bottom of her boot against the floor and walks away, rubbing her swollen eye. She hoped that her next toy will be less troublesome.
112332.title: You've Met with a Terrible Fate

1133.content: Where does Lorelei find you?
1133.title: Where are you?

11332.content: Where on Four Island are you?
11332.title: Her hometown of Four Island

113323.content: Where else could you be? (Seriously, it’s a tiny island.)
113323.title: Other

choices: Other (even though I’ve covered pretty much everything)
1133233.content: Really testing your options, aren’t you?
1133233.title: Other

12.content:
Which Johto official will you choose?

(To avoid future confusion, Bugsy is male.
Koga is considered the Elite Four for Johto, not the sixth Gym Leader for Kanto.
Blue is considered the Champion, not the eighth Gym Leader in the Johto games; check the Kanto section for him.
Bruno is considered the Elite Four for Kanto, not the Elite Four for Johto; check the Kanto section for him.
Lance is considered the Champion for Johto, not the Elite Four for Kanto.)
12.title: Johto

choices: "...Wh- What the hell is that?!" No, he isn't responsible.
"Ah! What are you doing in there?" Yes, he is, but he wants to protect you.
"Oh, right. Never mind." Yes, he is, and he wants you to be food!
1211.content:
You wake up in something soft and for a second you think it's just your bed, but it's only as your senses clear up that you realise something feels wrong. You open your eyes and get up, and you notice that you're in a bed of... hay? You look around and see you are in some sort of enormous cage or hatch - you're surrounded by hatched wire walls and there's certainly a large door that's locked by a catch on the outside. You're obviously wondering why you are in some sort of enormous cage or hatch when you turn around and nearly die of shock.

It's a huge bird. It's easily the biggest animal you've ever seen and while it was sleeping, it has now awoken and its head has now tilted in your direction. You freeze on the spot, hoping that those hungry eyes will ignore you if you stay still, but slowly the enormous creature shuffles over. It caws at you, and it's pretty much confirmed that the 'stay still' strategy isn't working. You run to the wired walls and try to claw your way through, but you can't fit through the holes and the wire is too tough to get rid of. The bird shuffles closer, looming over you, and its beak opens and shuts, its tongue writhing in anticipation. You close your eyes and wait for the inevitable.

"Pidgey? Is something wrong?" A voice calls out. The bird pauses, looking in the direction of its master. You open your eyes and join in the looking. A young man has walked over and is now looking through your prison. He has dark blue hair, his fringe flicked over his right eye, while his left eye scans around in its deep blue. He is wearing a light blue vest over a blue shirt, and you can see the name 'Falkner' written on one of his armbands, but you can't see anything else from your viewpoint. He has blotted out the light and the giant has cast a shadow over you, making you even more frightened than before.

"Hm? What is that?" His single exposed eye contracts and narrows on you. You try your best not to faint as the giant examines you. Was he even expecting you?
1211.title: Falkner: The Elegant Master

12113.content:
"Oh, right. Never mind." The boy barely seems impressed at the tiny person in his birdcage. It's almost as if he was expecting this...

"D-Did you do this to me?!" You ask.

He nods. "It's better not to ask how. I got a friend to do it, that's all you need to know. That and it's best not to struggle."

You can only look from his cold stoic face, back to the hungry-eyed Pidgey and then back to him. "You- N-No, you couldn't possibly-" You just gawk for a moment before taking a deep breath. "...I'm food?!"

Falkner stares at you for a moment, before he reaches over and flicks the catch on the cage, opening the door and reaching his arm in. You immediately run away from his reach, but the Pidgey caws and plants a talon in front of you, blocking your path. You scream as Falkner's hand snatches you and you are lifted into the air. He cranes his arm and hovers you over the open mouth of...
12113.title: Feeding Time

choices: ...and you grip into it, causing Falkner to gag and cough you out.
...and your hands slip. Falkner swallows you down whole.
121132.content:
...himself?! It was horrific enough when you thought Falkner was going to feed you to one of his pet birds, but this is just-

"You- You can't really be- Stop!" You stammer at him, feeling yourself swing in the air over his upturned head.

He smirks back at you. "I am. It's not that bad. It's just like eating an insect, and I heard they're a delicacy."

"B-But I'm a person!"

"Sure, you tell yourself that. Now go ahead and struggle, that's half the fun."

Falkner parts his lips, showing his open maw. It's a dark pit that leads to a very unpleasant end. You kick and scream and try anything to get away, but Falkner is barely phased and simply releases his grip on you, dropping you into his mouth. The world flips back upright as he turns his head back down, and you stumble around as you look around. You are sprawled out on Falkner's enormous tongue, dry but wetting at your touch, and it flicks around and slathers you. You try and kick it away, and Falkner promptly flops his tongue out before pressing you against the roof of his mouth, rubbing up and down and tasting you even more. Something that sounds like a moan echos from the ominous hole at the back of his throat. You are simply kneaded and rubbed like a piece of candy before Falkner gives another moan and flicks you backward, sending you sliding towards his throat. You pant and heave, frightened beyond belief - this can't be the way you go, can it?!

Falkner's uvula swings in front of you, and you get the right idea just as Falkner begins to tilt his head and try to swallow you down. You take a deep breath and jump at the uvula. Your hands wrap onto the soft blubbery muscle...
121132.title: Falkner's Meal

choices: Yes; you manage to avoid him and find a hiding place.
No; you pick a poor path and he finds you.
1211321.content:
Your grip holds around the uvula, and it immediately gets the reaction you were aiming for - the whole mouth seems to convulse for a moment, before it stops its tilt and a violent motion throws you out of Falkner's mouth as he gags and coughs you out. The whole world is a blur and you have a few milliseconds to realize that you've traded one method of death for another - it's a long way down. You close your eyes and brace for the impact...

...And you land on something soft and fluffy. Slowly, you peek your eyes open and you find yourself in a bundle of giant feathers. It seems like there's a lot of these littered around the floor (as a result of the several bird cages around the room) and you were lucky enough to land in the biggest pile. You sigh and count your blessings, but then a fit of coughing ceases and you remember something rather important.

"Argh!" Falkner says, his voice hoarse and weak from his choking. "Where are you?!"

Falkner walks towards a bundle of feathers behind him, sending vibrations across the stone floor with each massive step, and furiously stomps on the pile. The feathers are mushed and ground beneath the treads of his shoes, and you figure that if he finds you, you'll be among them too. Falkner curses under his breath as he searches through the remains to ensure he didn't miss anything, and curses much more loudly when he realizes it wasn't the one you were in. In the distance, you can see some furniture where you can hopefully hide under and escape him for good, but you have to evade him for long enough to reach them. You wait for Falkner to pick another pile of feathers, and despite your exhaustion, you run as fast as you can to another pile while his back is turned. The only question is whether you are fast enough to evade him...
1211321.title: Out of the Frying Pan...

choices: ...a wild Bug Pokemon bursts out of the tall grass!
...a huge brown boot slams down in front of you!
1212.content:
The first thing you hear when you wake up is the whistling of birds, something you would expect to hear in the middle of the forest. It's only when your eyes clear that you realize you are in the middle of the forest - an enormous forest. You get up and look at the huge blades of tall grass around you. You have no idea where you are or why you're this size, but it's certainly not safe. With no other course of action, you head out to find some way back to normal.

As you venture through the jungle of grass, you keep hearing noises and seeing shadows, putting you on edge. You're too small to see above the grass and even if you could, you wouldn't be able to see far - it seems to be the early morning and only the maddest of people would be outside at this hour. Wild predators, on the other hand...

*snap*

You turn around and see a broken branch far away through the grass. Something is chasing you. You grab the nearest object - a tiny pebble, about the size of a football to you - and hold it for self-defence. You can feel tremors coursing through the dirt - either the footsteps of the predator or something else entirely. Suddenly...
1212.title: Bugsy: The Walking Encyclopedia

12121.content:
From the forest of grassblades, a creature bursts forth, flying above you and casting you in its shadow. You stumble backwards as a living Kaiju flies above you, circling in the air. Is it perhaps searching for something? Is it perhaps searching for you...?

You do your best to hide yourself amongst the grass, but whether or not it saw you, it decides to land nearby, its attennae twitching as it continues to search for its target. You finally identify the mysterious giant Pokemon...
12121.title: The Incredible Giant Insect

choices: On one of the tables, where a giant might eat.
On one of the chairs, where a giant might sit.
On the floor. where a giant might step.
1213.content:
You wake up, no longer in your safe bed and somewhere new and alien. The sky above you seems to be white, with a hint of cream, and there are no clouds. You get up, feeling the solid plastic of the earth, and wonder where on earth you could be. It's only when you look around the rest of your surroundings that you realize what has happened.

It's an ordinary shopping centre cafe. At least, it would be ordinary if it wasn't magnified in scale to the point that everything was gigantic and you were pretty much a bug in compared to the mountainous furniture. The room itself is very large, even by giant standards, and it seems to encompass an entire floor. One half of the room has a counter selling various knicks knacks and curios, which is unattended right now, and the other half of the room seems to be a cafe - and it's the half that you are currently in. There's a line of soda machines on the far wall, along with a counter and small kitchen (also unattended) on the opposite wall. There are a handful of tables and chairs, and they too are uninhabited. The calendar on the wall says that it is a Sunday, so the cafe will be closed, but that doesn't eliminate the idea that someone might bring their own lunch and sit here. You don't want to be eaten or sat on or stepped by a hungry weekend shopper.

...Actually, where exactly are you?
1213.title: Whitney: The Pretty Girl

choices: You make the leap and, with quick thinking, grab onto her leg as you fall.
You hesitate for too long and she sits on top of you.
12132.content:
It takes a while to gauge your surroundings at your scale, but the red plastic of the "floor" and the single towering "wall" is eventually pieced together as "a chair". You wonder how you ended up here, of all places, but it's not the most pressing question on your mind right now - "how do I get down?" happens to be in first place. Peering over the edge of the chair, you see the long drop to the tiled floor below. You have a feeling that your smaller mass will help to survive the fall, but you aren't going to bet your life on loose physics that might be wrong. Then again, you can't think of any other plan of action for getting off this chair...

As you realize the harsh situation, the elevator door to the cafeteria opens and a girl steps out. The first thing you notice about her is her bright pink hair, and her equally bright and (somehow) equally pink eyes. She is wearing a white buttoned shirt, blue shorts, long striped socks, and brown shoes. Even from this distance, you can see her swaying her head to a beat, and you notice the earbuds trailing from her shorts pocket to her ears. She is also carrying a small plastic box with some snacks inside. The girl doesn't seem to notice the emptiness of the cafe - or of anything else, for that matter, as she hums to herself to her music. She heads towards the nearest seat.

This, of course, just so happens to be the one you're on.

With each step, you look from her to the long drop and back at her. If you stay around, there will be an inevitable end and you're not sure if you can survive that weight. Of course, you're not sure if you can survive that height either. You quickly weigh up the options, just as the girl stands by the seat and begins to sit down...
12132.title: Make Way for Whitney

choices: She stay where she is for little longer
121322.content:
you hesitated too long and you see the ass of the giant come down on you you are crushed under the weight of the young woman
What does she does do
121322.title: You hesitate for too long and she sits on top o...

12133.content:
You're on the floor, which stretches out almost endlessly as a smooth, snow-white plain of tiles. The occasional discarded receipt or stomped-out cigarette serves as the only noticeable terrain, besides the enormous landmarks that make up the furniture of the cafeteria. You begin to contemplate where exactly you should start heading, when you hear a 'ding' to the north.

Over in the horizon, the elevator doors open and a girl, almost monolithic in her size even from your 'distance', steps out. She has distinctive pink hair, and the curtains match the windows. She is wearing a white buttoned shirt, blue shorts, long striped socks, and brown shoes. She begins to walk into the cafeteria, causing heavy vibrations through the tiled floor that only get stronger and stronger with each approaching step. You look around for some cover or some hiding place, but the nearest thing you can find is an empty drink can, which might as well be a million miles away at this size. You raise your arms and yell, but the girl is too absorbed in her mobile phone to notice you, and she is in a direct collision course with you! With little else to do, as one of her gigantic shoes raise into the air and cast a shadow over you, you pick a direction and dive, hoping that you'll jump away in time. You throw yourself to the...
12133.title: Whitney's Massive Steps

choices: You climb onto her shoe to hitch a ride.
121331.content:
You throw yourself to the left and brace for impact.

It never happens. A resounding thud slams down next to you, shaking you to your bones, and you see one of Whitney's massive shoes proudly stood where you might have been if you had chosen otherwise. You breath a sigh of relief.

As Whitney pauses to examine something on her phone, letting out a string of angry gibberish and sort-of-possibly-curse-words over someone called 'Chuck' and his 'dumb mustache', your eyes trail over her shoe, and you notice that her shoelaces are untied, with one of them splayed out. If you act quickly enough, you could use it to climb up and hitch a ride to wherever she is going. Then again, given her childish babbling over her phone and the clumsy way she was walking around, you're not entirely sure she would be the best protector. Then again, what else is there but the floor...?
121331.title: Want a Ride with Whitney?

1213311.content:
You're not intent on sitting on the floor of the cafeteria for any longer, just so you can stepped on by someone else. You run forwards and latch onto the errant shoelace, shimmying up as fast as you can. You scramble across the leather platform of the shoe and quickly look for somewhere to secure yourself. Just as Whitney finishes her text, you wedge yourself between her ankle and the tongue of her shoe - it's a little uncomfortable, but when she begins walking and the world becomes a blur with each of her massive steps, you're glad that you took the right precaution.

The rollercoaster ride of her shoe goes on for a while, making you light-headed with all the wild movement, swinging up and down with each step. You see other giants passing by as the giantess walks through the department store, and the cacophany of booming footsteps makes you uneasy. Eventually, the giant seems to find where she was heading...
1213311.title: Riding with Whitney

choices: Yes - Whitney sits down and spots you on her shoe.
No - Whitney kicks her shoes (and you) to the side without looking.
12133112.content:
The world becomes a whirlwind of confusion as you are flung up and down with each wide step Whitney makes. As she middles with the crowds and makes her way towards her destination, you can see the crowds of giants stomping around you, the cacophony of heavy footsteps making you even more anxious than you already were. As you see the stampede of high heels and sneakers around you, you take some relief in your ride - despite how nauseating this was, it was still a better alternative than if you had tried to leave the department store on foot.

Mercifully, Whitney makes her way through the crowds towards her shop of choice - a shoe store. She walks in and you are thankful for the much more peaceful atmosphere of the store. Whitney briefly converses with a clerk before making her way through the shop and picking out a new pair of shoes.

As she makes her way to a private dressing booth at the back of the store, you feel hope rising in your chest - if she's going to change her shoes, then she'll have to notice you. From your 'nest' in between her ankle and the tongue of the shoe, there's no way she could miss you, right?

(Unless, of course, she just kicked her shoes away without looking because she was in a rush...?)
12133112.title: Shoe Shopping with Whitney

choices: She notices you're a tiny person.
121331121.content: As the enormous girl sits down in the private booth, her eyes pan down towards her shoes as she intends to remove them. However, a tiny figure - wedged between her ankle and the tongue of her shoe - grabs her attention. Her large eyes peer down, trying to discern the minuscule creature. Meanwhile, you feel the gaze of the giantess on you, and wonder if you should be filled with hope or dread as they widen...
121331121.title: Whitney Spotted You!

1213311211.content: But is she nice or mean?
1213311211.title: She notices you're a tiny person.

12133112111.content: Yes she's nice in fact ________________________________________________________.
12133112111.title: Nice

choices: She drop you in her sock
12133112112.content: She is mean in fact
12133112112.title: Mean

choices: It's Mary, the Goldenrod Tower DJ!
It's... Ariana, the Team Rocket Admin?!
1213312.content:
You've heard enough gossip about Whitney's clumsiness, over-enthusiasm, and frequent temper tantrums - you decide that, even with the best of intentions, she'd still be a danger to you. You retreat behind one of the towering legs of the cafeteria tables, and watch in silence as Whitney finishes checking her phone and walks away. You expect that she'll trip over that untied shoelace not too long from now...

With the rest of the cafeteria empty, you resign to simply scouring the massive room for anything useful. You find some still-fresh crumbs and hang onto them for a later date, and you also find a bit of graphite that seems sharp enough to use as a weapon in self-defense (against something your size, of course - it'd barely tickle a giant.)

You spend some time exploring more, finding nothing noteworthy, and theorizing on what to do next, when fate decides to intervene as you feel those familiar tremors again - another giant is approaching. Once again, you slip behind a table leg for cover, and peek around the side to see which Goldenrod resident is stomping their way over here now...
1213312.title: Alone in the Cafeteria

choices: "Hm, nobody is here." She is unaware of you.
"Where are you hiding...?" She knows you're here somewhere!
12133122.content:
Whitney's giant soft-soled sneakers were loud enough on the cafeteria tiles, but the footsteps of the approaching giant are even louder, as her hard high-heeled boots come into view when you peer around the side of the table leg. They clash down on the ground with an intimidating stride that, even at a regular size, would make you think twice about getting in her way. A black-and-white skirt-dress trails upwards over a slim figure (with respectable hips and an impressive chest, of course) and red hair twinned with golden earrings. There's not mistaking it - she might not be wearing her Team Rocket attire, but this is the infamous criminal, Ariana.

As her massive boots continue to stomp throughout the empty cafeteria, making you tremble with each earth-shaking vibration, you do your best to stay safely hidden from view behind the table leg. As you wait in tense silence, Ariana says something aloud to herself...
12133122.title: Prepare for Trouble...

choices: You successfully make it away without alerting Ariana.
"Aha! There you are!" Ariana spotted you!
121331222.content:
"Where are you hiding...?"

You practically feel the sinister syllables rolling on your skin, each note in Ariana's voice giving the very-clear implication that she is not going to be very friendly. Her massive high heels continue to clash across the smooth tiles, whilst you remain out of her sight behind the table leg. Of course, as you begin to wonder if this is a good hiding place or not, Ariana begins to kneel down and examine underneath the tables, her large red eyes prying for any little things of interest (i.e. you.) She hasn't checked your table yet, but there's only so many in the cafeteria...

You do your best to find an opening, eyeing the cafeteria exit. It seems so far away, but with some timing and luck, you could get there before she notices. As Ariana searches underneath another table, her back turned from you, you take a deep breath and make a dash out of your cover towards freedom...
121331222.title: Tiny Espionage Action

choices: ...reaching her hand down to snatch you up.
...raising one of her boots above you!
1213312222.content:
"Aha! There you are!"

Uh oh.

You nervously turn your head as you run, and see the enormous woman already straightening up to her full height. If her sheer size and imposing stature wasn't intimidating enough, the predatory look in her crimson eyes certainly was. You keep moving as fast as you can, but with just a few rumbling footsteps, Ariana has already covered the distance and her long shadow stretches over you, sending a cold chill down your spine.

You glance again and, to your shock, the gigantic Team Rocket executive is...
1213312222.title: Spotted by Ariana!

12133122221.content:
You do your best to evade the approaching hand of the giantess, but your small form has no chance of escaping her reach. Her enormous fingers surround you and coil around your body, trapping you in their powerful (yet surprisingly soft) grasp. You hear the giant laugh for a moment as she brings you up through the air in her iron fist. You are treated to an equally stunning and intimidating display as her face looms over you, engraving the image of her blood-red eyes and her malicious smile into your mind.

The Team Rocket executive laughs again (giving you a split-second glimpse of her mouth and the darkness within.) "It's no use running, my little..."
12133122221.title: In Ariana's Grasp

121332.content: You move to the right, only for Whitney's massive shoe to crash right down on your tiny body. Whitney feels a tiny crunch under her shoe but just ignores it. Now, all that's left of you is a tiny blood spot on the sole of Whitney's shoe.
121332.title: ...right.

choices: Reveal yourself and try to get his attention.
Hide and wait to see what else he does.
A voice calls out from above - it's 'Eusine' again.
1221.content:
You wake up to the smell of burning wood. It startles your senses and you jump to your feet, now awake and alert. Luckily nothing is burning, but not so luckily you are now aware of your new surroundings. It's a huge pit that seems to be the burnt remains of an old buildings; wooden stairs and platforms still hang around in the edges or scattered around, but most of them seem to be bits and pieces left over from an old fire, especially with the blackened wood and the hanging smell in the pit. The worst part of this whole thing, however, is that while the pit would normally be big in itself, it is practically massive to your scale - you are essentially the size of an insect in the remains of this building meant for giants.

Speaking of which, you suddenly hear voices from above, near one of the surviving wooden stairs at the edge of the pit.

"I swear I saw Suicune here! Honest!" An eccentric man insists.
"Eusine, please, I saw it head west last night," A more calm yet slightly eerie voice says. "Now please, let me honour the grounds in peace. Go find your legendary pet without me for once."
"I- Yes, sorry, Morty. I've just been-"
"I understand. Go find Suicune. I'll catch up on the legendary search soon enough."
"Thank you, Morty."

There are footsteps that grow quieter as they trail off, while another pair of footsteps grow slightly louder as they approach, coming from the wooden staircase and across the darkened stone floor. You quickly leap behind a fallen beam of wood - the size of a fallen building to you - as the giant approaches. You peek around the edge just as a huge pair of black and purple shoes slam down ahead of you, nearly knocking you off balance with their huge tremors. The man himself is dressed in white trousers and a black coat, along with a long purple scarf and a purple headband. It is wrapped around his soft blonde hair and above his dim violet eyes. He looks around the charred remains, before bowing and apparently meditating. As the giant shuts his eyes and hangs in the silence, you wonder what to do...
1221.title: Morty: The Mystic Seer

12211.content: The giant begins to search around the remains, apparently looking for something, and you decide it's best to try and get some help - he's the only person around and you figure you won't be able to get out of this demolished basement by yourself. As he searches through a burnt bookcase, you head out from behind the fallen beam and run over to him. Standing by his feet, you look up and you are even more intimidated than before - it's like the Statue of Liberty, except moving and possibly violent. He hums as he looks through one of the books that survived the blaze, his attention elsewhere, and you decide that you'd better think of something quick. You could try climbing up him (his clothes look easy enough to hold onto) but that will certainly be a challenge, or perhaps you could tag a ride on his shoe - though you'll have to hold on and wait until a better oppurtunity.
12211.title: Climb or Ride?

choices: Hide in his pocket for now.
122111.content:
You decide it is best to get climbing while you can. Luckily, Morty seems invested in the book he found, so he should remain still for a while. You walk up to the seemingly impossibly tall purple wall that is Morty's right leg. You give a tug of the material and it seems rough enough for you to get a grip on. Sighing and steeling yourself with the climb, you jump up and grab onto his trousers. He doesn't notice you as you make your ascent, slowly but surely, as you take the climb one grab at a time. It is exhausting, but "not falling" is enough motivation to keep you going.

You climb and climb, and after a few tiring moments, you find yourself at his waist. His trouser pocket is beside you, open and inviting. You could take a rest and wait for a better time to try making the rest of the way up, or just push forwards and try and make it now. You're not sure how long he might stay standing in this spot as he reads his book, and when he's moving, you feel that this will get a lot more difficult.
122111.title: Mt. Morty

choices: A light shining from above you again -- he's noticed you!
A force from behind -- you're still unnoticed, and Morty is moving again.
1221111.content:
You decide to play it safe, and slip yourself into his pocket. You slide down, not hitting a soft bottom like you expected, but hitting a hard, cold object. Through the very dim light coming through the fabric, you can make out the ridges on the surface you're standing on -- one of his keys. You immediately jump off the key once you realize what it is, not wanting to create any sound that the titan would notice, and actually land at the bottom this time. Sighing and looking up, you realize that you didn't think of how deep his pockets would be, and that it would be a challenge escaping.

At that moment, you feel movement from behind -- it seems that you've made the right choice. Coincidentally, the climb up had been more tiring than you'd expected, and you decide that now would be a good time to regain some energy. Despite the loud clinking of the keys beside you, you couldn't help but sleep.

When you eventually wake, you can't see the keys. A clicking noise and the sound of a door shutting are heard, just before a light from above comes. The keys drop into the pocket unceremoniously, narrowly missing you, and you scream out of instinct. You cover your mouth, hoping that Morty hadn't heard you.

With bated breath, you begin to tremble. Honestly, you didn't want him finding you yet. You had to be sure it was safe. You had to time this right... but the perfect time might be interrupted. The next thing you notice is...
1221111.title: Playing it safe.

choices: Yes; you introduce yourself and shake his hand-- er, finger.
No; you can't take the overwhelming terror and begin crying.
12211111.content:
You look up from your position and see two things: a light above, and part of the distant face of the giant, the rest covered by his scarf. You have no idea if he can see you, but you see that one of his eyebrows is raised -- likely in confusion. Your heart pounds against your chest as you rethink your decision to scale this behemoth.

The light is blocked by the pocket briefly closing, and for a moment, you feel safe. Maybe he didn't see you, or mistook you for something else. But no, this wasn't the case; as soon as you feel safe, the feeling is ruined by a hand reaching in, and it was coming fast. You back up, but that's cut short too, this time by a feeling of warmth at your back. Turning your head, you realize that this warm feeling is coming from one of Morty's fingers -- no, one of his fingertips. And once again, your thoughts are cut off by that same warmth pressing against your front, this time from his thumb. As you're being held, you think of how small you must be to be dwarfed by a fingertip and shudder.

You feel another sudden movement, and this time it's you being pulled out of your hiding spot. You can't really see much of anything, other than the skin of the thumb that's pressing upon your entire body, until you're eventually dropped. You scream, thinking this is going to kill you, but you land safely with a slight bounce. The sudden light change forces you to blink rapidly, until you get used to the light after a couple seconds. In these short moments, you realize that you're now sitting in the titan's open hand, being looked down at by said titan, and he was curious. You weren't sure whether that was good or bad.

"Amazing," was the first thing he said about you. Though it was a whisper, the calm and eerie tone was unsettling, causing another instinctive tremble as you shut your eyes. Maybe if you two were about the same size, you wouldn't be quite as scared of this man, but that wasn't the case, now, was it?

"You don't have to be so afraid, you know. I'm not going to hurt you." You open your eyes once more, and you see a calm, gentle smile on his face. To tell the truth, you honestly didn't expect this, someone that seems to care about an infinitesimal being. You do fear this is a ruse, of course, considering that anyone powerful who wanted to gain trust would say that. Also, the way his voice is just gives off the feeling of someone who can't be trusted, giant or otherwise.

You scramble back, but you hit a wall created by his fingers -- he'd cupped his hand to make sure you didn't fall. And speaking of hands, what you failed to notice until just now was his other one, right next to you, with only the index finger extended.

"I understand your fear, but really, you have nothing to worry about. Reassurance aside, I believe we should introduce ourselves before anything. My name's Morty. And you are?"

You might have to trust Morty, although you were trying to avoid confrontation until you knew it was safe. Still, you don't feel at ease with this man whatsoever -- you just might start crying in fear soon.

Do you put your fears aside, at least for now?
12211111.title: First Contact

choices: Extreme Gentleness; He being very patience with you
Extreme annoyance; He losing his patience with you
122111112.content:
Your fear and your thoughts build up a little too much.

You started to cry uncontrollably, your vision became very blurry “Hey, Hey calm down......” Morty coo to you as he curl his fingers; trapping you in his fist with only light is the tiny hole between his fingers. You feel and hear the earthquakes he was making and the only you can think of ‘Is going to hurt me now?’ ‘Did I anger him?’ ‘Is this a trick?’.

You was too busy in you own world, you didn’t notice that the earthquakes stop and the light flood in. “Hey, are you alright? You’re not hurt, right?” You feel something leathery and hot on gliding on your back, it took you a moment to register it but when your eyesight cleared you see Morty rubbing your back. You pull yourself away from the finger; His change again and put his hand on his head. He close his eyes and sighs, before looking back at you.

His face look...
122111112.title: No; you can't take the overwhelming terror ...

choices: Get on the scarf now; it'll be easier later.
Keep going; you'll deal with the scarf later.
1221112.content:
You can't stop now, you're already about halfway there. You keep going up, and despite the exhaustion you feel, your body is driven by motivation to get some help. Besides, you're at the border between smooth and textured fabric. Taking the black knitted material in one hand, then the other, you briefly admire its plush feel before working your way up the colossus once more.

You can't tell how long it takes you to get there, but you know that by the time you reach the scarf's tattered red end, you haven't felt much movement from the titan at all. Of course, now you have a decision to make: do you scale the scarf now, or wait until you get closer to his neck to do so?
1221112.title: Going up?

choices: Your hopes were wrong; Morty is on the move.
You're absolutely right; all you felt was a draft.
12211121.content:
You decide that dealing with the folds of the scarf will be much simpler after you scale the hanging end, rather than climbing up the scarf at its bulkiest points. As you reach out to grab the edge, you feel that this scarf is better than the shirt in terms of places to hang onto -- it's knit, and it has some holes scattered upon it. Looks like you made a good decision already. You give yourself a smile of self-approval as you hoist your body onto the somewhat raggedy cloth, but this is no time to stop. You must keep going, you need help getting back home, or at least back to your old size.

After a few minutes, you notice that the scarf seems to have far fewer holes to hold once the border between red and violet is breached. You find this sort of interesting, but still, it's useless information. Though, you do take this brief moment to catch your breath; climbing a living being is a lot harder than insects make it seem... You take one last deep breath before resuming your ascent.

As you keep moving up, you feel something, some windy force moving behind you. You swear to yourself for not taking the opportunity to hide in the titan's pocket, but there's no turning back now. You hold onto the scarf tightly, hoping this is a false alarm.
12211121.title: A holey ascent

122112.content:
The giant's enormous sneakers are more than a little intimidating as he shuffles his feet, catching pebbles and tiny bits of wood beneath his huge red treads. The black-and-purple material looks clean, and for a moment, you get a great idea (or at least, an idea that's better than climbing all the way up that monumental height...)

Just as Morty seems content with his search, you throw yourself onto his left shoe, grabbing onto the material as hard as you can. Morty walks away, and his foot swings through the air swiftly with each step, threatening to hurtle you away yet failing to do so as you maintain your grip. It sends your stomach into spins and the world becomes a dizzying blur with each 'fun ride' but you refuse to let go.

Meanwhile, oblivious to his tiny passenger, Morty walks towards...
122112.title: Riding with Morty

choices: You go somewhere else to get her attention.
You go somewhere else to hide.
1223.content:
You wake up slowly, vaguely aware that you're not where you usually sleep. You blink and get up, getting your bearings as you suddenly discover your new surroundings. You are in a bedroom - and the bedroom is massive. It's a room fit for a giant and you might as well be an insect in this enormous place (and you are even more frightened as you realise there just be insects in here - to scale.) The room has very subdued wallpaper, a light creamy yellow, and there are framed photos hanging on the wall, most of them showing a girl with brown hair who seems very shy about the camera. Among the furniture is a bed, with a very stern and powerful looking metal frame yet a very soft and fluffy mattress, and other standards like a wardrobe and bedside table. On the table is a large metal display case, which looks like it was forged over a thousand years and completely unbreakable, yet has several valuable looking jewels and decorations inside, all of them sparkling and happy. Through the window you can see a large lighthouse in the distance. You yourself are in the middle of the room, trapped in a field of grey carpet. As most people would, you freak out over the situation for a while.

Your freak out is put on hold, however, as you hear footsteps coming from the mountainous door. Someone's coming! You're not sure who it is and you can't say the thought of meeting a giant puts you at ease, but you need help, right? You don't know, but you have to decide fast.
1223.title: Jasmine: The Steel-Clad Girl

12231.content:
There's honestly no way you could make it anywhere else in time unless you took another choice where you could do that so you decide to stay put. Your current plan is to wait for the giant to arrive, jump up and down, wave your arms, and shout a lot. It's not much of a plan, but it's a plan. The huge door swings open and the room's owner walks in, sending tremors through the earth with her footsteps.

The girl looks very frail, being rather lean and skinny. She has long copper hair with two decorations that shape her hair like two angel wings. Her eyes are the same colour; a faint and shiny brown. She is wearing a white skirt, complete with a large red ribbon on her chest, and shiny white sandals. You would call her pretty if she wasn't several hundred feet tall (to you) and easily capable of snuffing out your life with her thumb if she wanted to.

She hasn't noticed you, however, and as she walks into the room, you break out of your mesmerized gaze and take up your plan. You leap to your feet, jumping up and down, waving your arms and shouting to get the attention of the giantess. Unfortunately, she seems to be wiping tears from her eyes and sniffling under her breath - something has upset her, and she is too busy crying to notice you. Her path through the room is straight across you and suddenly you regret your decision to stay in the middle of the room.

You make one last final scream at her, just as her left leg begins to lift and a shiny white sandal begins to descend from above you...
12231.title: Steel Thyself

choices: You might as well try and wake her back up...
"Mag? Magne?" You hear something coming into the room!
122311.content:
Jasmine is about to complete her ordinary walk through her ordinary room on this ordinary room when she hears something not so ordinary. It's almost like a shriek, a tiny one that seems to be coming from... the floor? She looks down and sees something by her feet. It jumps up and down, flailing around, and she kneels down to examine it closer. It looks like a...

*

The giantess crouches down, blotting out the sun (which happens to be the ceiling lamp) and shrouding you in shadow. You freeze, frightened as her huge eyes narrow and then suddenly expand as she recognizes what you are.
"I- Wh-" She stammers, her lips trying to make some kind of intelligent sound but the shock of the impossible thing on her bedroom floor stops her. "Wh- Y- This is-" Her eyes flitter away for a second, her eyelids topple over, and her body topples over just as slowly, as the shy girl simply faints. The giant drops to the floor on her side, sending a single shockwave across the floor and tripping you over. As you groan and get back up, the girl lies unconscious. She's breathing quietly and seems otherwise fine. You're not sure what to do if this girl is so easy to shock...
122311.title: Jasmine fainted!

choices: She flat out pretends youre not there!
1223112.content:
Before you could decide what to do with this gigantic unconscious funny-haired women (and how many times!) you overhear mechanical sounds heading your way. Could it be a toy-robot or a cleaning droid or one of the daleks invading this girl's land to enslave and/or exterminate her race? Regardless of what it was, you take no chances and dash under one of the dressers and watch from a distance.

"Mag? Magne? Magnemite..."

You spot a big floating one-eyed orb with magnets and big screws connected to it hovering toward the direction of the giant girl.

"...Mag..." it looked down at the girl and processed some kind of emotion, "....MAAAAG?!" You assume it processed absolute shock.

"Magnemite!! Magnemite!!" you assumed it was telling her to wake up as it poked her with it's magnets, "MAG! NEMITE!!" Uh oh. She's not waking up.

"Hell's bells," you whispered to yourself in worry, "I hope I didnt give that poor giant a heart attack!" Despite only meeting her for a brief five seconds before passing out, you worried for her sake and hoped you didnt inadvertently kill her! In fact, you were SO worried about her, you felt obligated to give her a fitting name to call her. You decided to name her after your favorite Disney princess... but since 'Mulan' isnt technically a princess, you went for the next best name: 'Jasmine'!

"MAG...nemite?!" the floating orb you decided to call 'Magnemite' cuz that's all it says suspected the worst. It squinted it's eye in deep thought, thinking what to do. It gave Jasmine a worried look. Then it closed it's eye as if given no other choice but to resort to drastic measures.
"That cant be good," you whispered as it began to surge!

"Mag... NEMITE!" it shot an electrical surge at Jasmine, given her a powerful, yet hopefully low-voltaged jolt!

"OH!!!" Success! Jasmine woke right up with a sudden jolt! You sighed in relief, thanking the lord you dont have to bear the guilt of accidental murder. Unfortunately, you still had a GREATER problem on your hands!
"Wh....m...magnemite!" Jasmine gasped as Magnemite floated to her in concern.
"Magne? Mag?" it probably asked if she was alright.
"Y-yes, I'm fine, Magnemite," Jasmine nodded, but then shook her head and frowned, "No... no I'm not! I... I'm seeing them again."
'Seeing them?' you wondered.

"Mag?" Magnemite tilted it's head.
Jasmine's face went red, "The... the little people." Your eyes widened so big they almost burst! 'Little people' she said?!

"Maaaaaaag..." Magnemite raised it's only eyebrow at her.

"I know! I know!" she grabbed both sides of her head and shook it with frustration, "but it was right there! Right in front of me! I looked down and the next thing I knew, I woke up right here!" So she does remember seeing you. That's good... but 'little PEOPLE'? There's more than one?
"Mag. Magne mag mag." Magnemite shook it's head in disbelief.
"I dont know why I'm still seeing them!" Jasmine was REALLY panicking, "they were everywhere! In my room, at the gym, at the lighthouse, in the trashcan, in my cereal, in Steelix's cage, EVERYWHERE!" You REALLY hope she was hallucinating those others! Otherwise... who knows how many other fellow victims wound up shrunken down and lost in this adventure?!

Magnemite gave an expression that seemed like a tired sigh.
"M-maybe I'm just a little sick!" she assured herself, "y-yeah that's... that's it! Sp...sparkle's sick! M-m-maybe I just caught her cold, that's all!"

"Maaggg...." Magnemite rolled it's eye and floated off, probably giving Jazz her 'personal space'.

"I'm not crazy!" Jasmine kept telling herself as she sweated, "I'm not going mad! I... I cant afford to lose my gym! Oh, what would Janina say? What would grandpa say?! Awww.... I'm gonna be the laughing stock of the Johto League!"

"Yikes, poor girl," you remark, "but if she's not really hallucinating, there might be others like me." If she can see the little people, youre gonna need her help finding them and rescuing them. "....Geez, who elected ME to be the hero of this adventure, anyway?!" On the other hand, if she IS just hallucinating those others, that means she's going insane. And insane giant girls are the kinds of people you should probably stay AWAY from!

Hell's bells, she's actually pounding her head with her fist! "There are no little people!" she repeats herself, "it's all in your head! There are no little people!! They're all in your he-huh?"

Her big hazel eyes locked on to your direction! She leaned her head down toward you... getting a BETTER look at you! You see even more sweat dripping down her forehead! Does this mean she sees you. Well, too late to run now.
Fortunately, she looked a hundred times more scared of you than you were of her. It'd be for the best that YOU make the first move before she flips and passes out or does something she'll regret.

You swallowed hard and smiled up at the giant scared girl, "Hello! Nice to meet you! I'm [Hunter]! What's your name?"
1223112.title: Jazz man.... OH JAZZ...MAN!!

choices: Jasmine believes you and everything goes smoothly.
12231121.content:
"J-j-j-j-jas...mine!"

You smiled; looks like you had actually guessed her name correctly.

"Jasmine... that's a nice name. Anyway, Jasmine, could you tell me why you think I'm a hallucination?" you asked, trying to sound as calm as you could. Still, there was a person hundreds of times your size in front of you; you hoped your voice wasn't cracking.

"B-Because... little p-p-people can't exist! And they can't be everywhere at once! There were so many of them... I know you're a hallucination!" she said dramatically, leaning her head down even further.

A bead of sweat broke out on your forehead. This is one HUGE girl.

"L-Listen... those other ones. You may have been able to see them, but w-were you able to confirm whether or not they were real? Surely you weren't able to touch them?"

Jasmine raised an eyebrow.

"W-Well..."

"I can assure you I'm real, and I can prove it to you. Go ahead and pick me up. You shouldn't be able to touch a hallucination..." you tried to reason.

"Um... I guess it won't hurt." she said, getting down on her hands and knees and reaching her hand toward you.

"Don't scream... don't scream... don't scream!" you chanted in your mind. You finally had the attention of a normal sized person; don't blow it know.

Still, the sight of that monstrously enormous hand moving slowly toward you almost made you lose your cool, which had been an advantage when reasoning with Jasmine.

Her palm rested on the ground before you, with her massive thumb and index finger poised to snatch you up. They clamped around your waste, pinning your entire body as you were lifted up.

Jasmine gasped, putting her other hand over her mouth as she indeed felt your presence, and she lifted you up to her face to get a better look.

"N-No. I-I could be crushed..."

You realized how powerless you were, but it was too late now. You had just made yourself far more vulnerable, without even the option to run.

Fear was still omnipresent in those billboard-sized eyes, but there was the faint glimmer of curiosity underneath it all. Meanwhile, you had lost the advantage of a calm mind. You and Jasmine simply stared at each other, both of you locked in fear of one another.
12231121.title: She needs a Pick-me-up...

122311211.title: Jasmine believes you and everything goes smoothly.

(Seriously? Second-guessing chapters are stupid.)

She gazes at you in wonder, then gently sets you down. She still seems amazed, though frankly you’d be more concerned if she wasn’t.

“So who... who are you?”

“I’m not sure. My memory only goes back about two minutes, when I woke up on your floor. Everything else is kind of fuzzy.”

“Don’t worry!” She beams at you. “I can take care of you while we figure out what to do!”

Before you can say anything, the door opens and one of her Pokemon enters.
1223112111.title: Feeling is believing

choices: ...another tiny person! (Oh crap, there are others!)
...there's nothing in her hand! (OH CRAP, SHE'S ILL!)
122311213.content:
As easy as it was to reduce yourself to screaming bloody murder and possibly causing HER to scream bloody murder and possibly result in her accidentally dropping you to the floor and you going splat and then probably freaking Jasmine out some more and then possibly giving her permanent mental scars which may result in her being thrown in a mental asylum and probably causing her to lose her gym leader license and her family to lose their gym which could possibly result in the region's economical collapse and possibly putting their major potential regional income in jeopardy and possibly resulting in bankruptcy which could result in the region being annexed by a Pokemon's version of Russia and-good lord, you thought REALLY hard on this, didnt you?!

Anyway, as easy as it was to do all THAT, you knew you had to keep a strong will and a strong spine or else... well, THAT could happen!
Unfortunately, the same couldnt be said about her. The look on her face reeked of disbelief. The way her big brown eyes were squinting at you told you that you didnt properly convince her. You could see the big sweat drops drip down her forehead. Then she shook her head.

"No. No no no no NO!" she shouted with desperation, "this cant be real! This cant possibly be real! There's no way this can be real!"
'Uh, shouldnt that me MY line?' you think to yourself, although you didnt have the guts to say it out loud.
Jasmine blinked her eyes. She blinked again. Then again. Then she rapidly blinked them!
"Why arent you disappearing?!" she questioned you like you knew the answer.
"Uh... disappear?"
"I know youre not real!" she scolded you for no apparent reason, "stop pretending to be!"

"Y-yes I am!"
"NO YOURE NOT!" oh no, she's angry! Instinctively, you curled into a little ball like a frightened roly-poly while she glared down at you. "There's no such thing as tiny little people!" Oh god, she's about to clench her fist! Her other hand was already clenched shut and you could see the fingers and thumb of the one youre on about to close in on your tiny body!

"No please stop!!" you begged, "dont kill me! I mean you no harm! I swear!"

Thankfully, despite the unnecessary outburst, Jasmine was not a heartless giant. Seeing you plea for your life, her angry quickly vanished and was immediately replaced with worry and regret.

"I-I'm sorry, I'm sorry!" she quickly apologized, "please dont be scared of me! I'm not going to hurt you! ...Wait a minute. Why am I apologizing to a figment of my imagination?"

"I-I-I'm not imaginary," you lifted your head out of our roly-poly ball, "y-you can feel me, cant you? P-Plus, you said you already saw others like me, right?" She began fidgeting. She was shaking so much you were worried you were gonna fall out of her hand and then all that stuff in the first paragraph would come to fruition!

Out of words to say at the moment, she just bit her lip and set you carefully down on a nearby desk. You thanked your creator over and over for such mercy as Jasmine started pacing back and forth across the room.

“This has got to be a dream,” she tells herself, “this has to be a dream! There's no other logical explanation for this!”

“But Jasmine, I-”
“Yes, I'm just dreaming!” she interrupts you and tells herself, “I'm fast asleep. Cozy and sound in my bed!”

“Jasmine, are you listening?”

“C'mon Jasmine! What were you thinking?” she keeps ignoring you, “you actually thought there were little people in your room? Ha ha! Dont be silly!”

You couldnt frown any harder than you were already doing at the moment. Youre in bigger trouble than you thought. Not only does it seem your new colossal friend isnt gonna help you, SHE seems beyond help! Now you cant help but question if she mentally snapped! Heck, you even wonder if she snapped so bad that she mightve actually IMAGINED the other little people! If not, you feel incredibly bad for your fellow liliputians that had the displeasure of meeting her and didnt live to tell the tale!

“Hello little guy! What's your name?”

Suddenly, you noticed Jasmine is smiling down at the floor.

“Nice to meet you, Nathan! I'm Jasmine! I'm Olivine City's gym leader in the real world!” she had a sudden change in her mood now that she believes herself to be in a dream. You raised your eyebrow. Was she talking to another shrunken person like yourself?!

“That's right, Nathan! I'm the Steel-type pokemon gym leader of the Johto League!” she nonchalantly introduced herself, “...sorry, but I think youre a little small to be pokemon battling with me.”

“Jasmine? Who are you talking to?” she peaked your attention so much, you couldnt help but wonder.

“Oh, it's another tiny person like you!” Jasmine happily answered, “hang on a second. Nathan, hop in my hand, I'd like you to meet [Hunter]. Dont worry, it wont hurt.” She carefully scooped something off the ground and carefully cupped it in her hand.

“Nathan, meet [Hunter]. [Hunter], this is Nathan!” she opened her palm and presented to you...
122311213.title: Nerves of Steel... molten steel...

choices: Tears. She's fine, just a bit bruised, if anything.
Tears and blood. She busted her nose and/or lip in the fall.
1223112131.content:
Well, at least she isn't making this up.

You wave hello, sort of nervous. On one hand, it was great to not be alone, but on the other hand... you shudder at the thought of people just like you and Nathan, and their fates to god knows what.

Nathan waves back. "Hey there... ha ha... you're [your name here]? Well, it's at least a bit comforting to not be alone in this..." He looks around, apparently just as scared and nervous as you.

"Yeah, I'm [your name here], haha.... oh god this is terrifying."

"Agreed." Nathan hops off of Jasmine's hand, going towards you with an arm extended. As he gets close, you take his hand in yours and shake. "We should stick together. I honestly don't feel safe."

"Oh, there's nothing to be afraid of!" The brunette chimes in, eyes wide and one twitching a bit, "This is just a dream! Nothing is real here! You're not real, I'm not really here, anything can happen. Watch! Ahahaha..."

Jasmine stands up, extends her arms to her sides, and jumps in the air as high as she can. She was trying to fly, as one would normally do in a lucid dream. Of course, since this is very real, all she really does is fall on her face. You and Nathan both wince as you're knocked on your butts by the force of the titaness's fall, not from your own minor pain but in sympathy for Jasmine's more intense pain.

You get up and run to Jasmine's face, followed closely by your new acquaintance.

"Are you okay?" You may be afraid of the giant woman, but you're not a heartless jerk. You feel that you have to see if she's okay.

She whimpers, and you see something coming from the side of her head. It's...
1223112131.title: You're not alone.

choices: You both make it, and Jasmine reacts poorly.
You make it and began your pep talk.
12231121311.content:
"Hey, try and see if there's any blood on that side..." you told Nathan, trying to check the giant girl for injuries. Jasmine seemed to whimper as the two of you crawled up the side of her face, one on each side. Nathan climbed up the right side of her face until he was standing on her right cheek, while you split off and ran parallel with him upon the opposite side.

"I don't see anything. She's okay!" Nathan called, just a small speck of a person on the other side of Jasmine's cheek. You smiled and sighed in relief, having seen nothing more than a bruise or two and no blood coming from her nose or mouth.

Nevertheless, tears were still streaming from her eyes, running in a river down her face deep enough to swim in from your perspective. She had taken to give a pathetic mewling whimper from time to time, her previous panic settling down into a no less miserable to her, but far less dangerous state of mind for you and Nathan.

Jasmine just lay there in a heap, refusing to get up as she seemed to accept the fact she was (actually wasn't) crazy. While you focused on her, Nathan was waving you down.

"She's not listening. We have to do something... She needs a pep talk of some kind..." he called to you from across the face.

"What do you suggest?"

"Hmm, how about this?" he seemed to be looking to the side of Jasmine's head, covered by her brown hair, "I'll take the right ear and you take the left ear! See if she's listen to us and make our voices clear!"

That kinda seemed like a dangerous idea, but Hunter was already seeming to walk to the thicket of hair while Jasmine was in her own little world. Well... at least it would be safer than out here if she decided to go on a rampage again. You began to trek to your destination.
12231121311.title: Unharmed but Still Scared

choices: Jasmine cancels the Gym battle (whew! She's still buying it!)
Jasmine goes to battle! (uh oh. She's suspects something!)
122311213112.content:
Thankfully it was no challenge to make the climb all the way up to Jasmine's ear. Sadly, it was because she was spending too much time burying her face in the carpet while crying her eyes out in mumbled sobs. Granted, you felt really really bad for her and you couldnt quite possibly imagine what she's going through right now. Then again, could SHE possibly imagine what YOURE going through?! ...and what youre about to?

The ear lobe was soft and squishy, but made for easy gripping as you climbed up it and made your way into the dark damp cavern that led to the ear canal. It felt awfully invigorating and uplifting just making that brave, courageous climb into that colossal mentally broken crybaby's ear. But then as soon as you took one step into the cave, your courageous demeanor vanished without a trace!

Your nerves shot look after taking too much of a big glance of this hellish abyss you willingly climbed in. It was much less a dark damp cave and much more like the belly of a wormlike alien! The soft slimy hairy organic walls pulsated rhythmically as yellowish puss squirted out of each crevice. Some of that yellow puss had already hardened and caked the soft filthy floor youre walking on. You could hear a faint whistling noise coming from the distance that leads to the ear drum, but you dare not go any further in out of some fear the walls would close behind you and you'd be stuck inside Jasmine's ear forever!
...Then you thought that if the inside of her ear was scary, imagine being inside her mouth! Let alone being trapped inside her gigantic stomach!

You swallow hard and remember that youre not alone. Nathan's here with you and he aint nearly as panicky as you are. If he can keep a strong spine in the face of danger, so can you. You remember the plan and to stick by it. It seemed like a rather dumb plan after thinking twice about it, but HE's got confidence, so why question it, eh?

'Follow his lead,' you think to yourself.

“Dear child… please dont cry...” Nathan's soft sympathetic and faux-prominent whisper echoed even in the chamber you were in!

Jasmine flinched lightly, but to you it was a big enough earthquake to cause you to lose your balance. She lifted her face from the carpet and looked around.

“W...who said that?” Jasmine timidly questioned.

“I did, dear child,” Nathan whispered, “wipe away those tears. You are not crazy.” Sure enough, this jump starts this stressed out gym leader. She gets up and looks around for the source of the voice.
“W-W-who are you?” she called out, “and where are you?”

“I am everywhere, dear child,” Nathan answered, “for I am… thine overseer. Thine maker and thine molder. Thine Almighty.” ...The hell?! He's pretending to be the voice of God?! He never said anything about doing that!
But sure enough, Jasmine gasped, Y….you mean…. youre Arceus?!”
You squinted your eyes for a moment and youre pretty sure Nathan did too before he answered, “...Sure.”

“W-w-wait!” she got skeptic, “p-prove it!”
And Nathan did.

“Barukh attah Adonai eloheinu melekh ha'olam, yotzeir 'or uvorei choshek 'oseh shalom uvorei et hakol.” he answered with a Hebrew prayer as proof that he was God. Damned if anyone knew how exactly that counts as concrete proof!

“*GASP!*” but apparently it was concrete proof enough for Jasmine! “Forgive me my Lord!” You flew and hit the waxy ceiling cuz she quickly bowed! “I meant you no disrespect when I doubted you!”

“Please lift your head my child,” Nathan spoke softly.
“Ok.” and again you hit the ceiling when she quickly stood back up! Youre gonna need to bathe in Purell to get all this gunk off you.
“Do not fret an inkling, my child,” it was amazing how Nathan kept his cool on his side while on YOURS, it's… yuck! “ye need maintain thine sharpest composure for the pressing matter I present to thou.”

You could imagine beaming up hearing that. “A… pressing matter?”

“The tiny ones you have encountered,” Nathan continued, “they were of no mere illusion. They are indeed real. And they are in dire need of your help. You, oh brave fierce courageous Steel gym leader of Olivine, have been chosen worthy of such a task!”

“W...wow...” she sounded a bit pressured, “I… I never thought the great Arceus thought so highly of me.” It was incredible how Jasmine was hanging on to every word that was coming out of the mouth of that tiny little speck in her other ear! She'd probably believe him if he told her she could fly if she simply climbed to the roof of her Gym and leaped off! Either she's that mentally vulnerable at the moment or Nathan is just THAT good a salesman.

*Knock knock knock* But just as opportunity came knocking, so did the door.

“Jasmine?” said the voice from the other side of the door, “you have a challenger for a badge.” Oh right. She has a day job after all.

“Tell them to cancel,” Nathan whispered.
“What? B-But I cant cancel a Gym battle. It's against the Regional Code of Conduct!” Jasmine, despite being shellshocked from the voice of God in her ear was still a Gym Leader through and through.
“Thy task thou has been given is of much greater importance.” Nathan attempted to persuade her.
“But… the last time I took time off for my Sparkle to recover, I was almost fired,” she whispered back.
“Does thou defy my order?” Nate turned up the heat.
“N...No… b-but...”
“Then do as thou art instructed!”

In all honesty, if you were Jasmine, even just as shaken up, you'd probably think something fishy was going on by now. Thinking that, you have a feeling Nathan's getting close to screwing up.
Nah, maybe youre just overthinking it. Of course, he's got this in the bag! Why would you doubt this guy after coming so far this whole... minute and a half?
122311213112.title: Arceus Vult!

1223112132.content:
"Hi Hunter, I'm Nathan. Nice to meet you," said absolutely nobody in her hand because there was nothing there! As if you werent scared enough of being extremely tiny, youre now terrified that youre extremely tiny in a room with a ginormous woman who just mentally snapped.

"Uh... Jasmine?" your voice got a little hoarse, but you told her, "there's nobody there."

"What are you talking about?" Jasmine's eyelids looked awfully wider than earlier, "of course there's somebody here. Tell him, Nathan."
You gulped hard, holding back your fears. "There is no Nathan, Jasmine."
"Quit talking nonsense, Nathan!" she ignored your pleas, "I told you I cant pokebattle you right now. Come back when you've grown."
"Nathan doesnt exist!" you tell her, "are you feeling ok?"

"Of course I'm ok! I'm perfectly fine," she said with a smile, though the widened eyes told a different story, "this is MY dream after all! Isnt that right, Alex?"

"Wh...who's Alex?"

"He's the other tiny person I found next to Nathan!" she points to another imaginary person in her hand, "See? There's Alex, Samantha, Roy, Roy II..."
"Oh no..." you squinted your eyes, fearing nothing but the worst for your mentally ill discoverer.
"They've all come from the planet Pokedimos to witness the universe's greatest Gym Leader duel against the evil Shauntal of Unova's Elite Four, who plans on enslaving the planet through her crappy fanfiction!" What in the... how badly did she hit her head when she fainted?!

"Ok, Jasmine maybe you really do need to lie down," now was a good time to get the hell out of there. She's gonna be way more harm than help, "I'll go find somebody else to-" Suddenly, Jasmine's foot hits the ground in front of you and blocks your path
"Why do you wanna leave?" she questioned, "all your friends are right here! Dont you wanna say hi?" Geez, she was demanding you to leave her alone earlier, now when you actually DO wanna leave her alone, she wont let you?!
"Th-that's alright, Jazz," you try to tell her, "you guys can have fun together, I'll just go-"

"Nope!" and then Jasmine quickly scooped you off the ground and it took every ounce of willpower not to scream bloody murder. You were extremely high off the ground and not held very tightly in her palm. If you so much as struggled,you'd plunge to your death!
Even worse, you almost lost your balance when she opened her palm and brought you up close to her face! Her huge, wide eerily smiling, eye-lid enlarged face! You ran out of willpower now! You want your mommy!
Roy
"Sorry, [Hunter]," she apologized, "but this is MY dream! And you, Nathan, Alex, Samantha, Roy, Roy II, and Wanda have special arrangements in my dream."
"Sp-special..." you shivered, trying hard to look down, "...a..arrangements?"

"Yep!" Jasmine nodded, "you and your friends have just been invited to Jasmine's special hotel and beach resort! Where only the VIP are allowed to stay at completely free of charge." Nonsense and more nonsense! When will this end?!

OH, BUT IT GETS BETTER. MUCH BETTER. Obviously not for you.

"You first, Nathan," Jasmine plucks the imaginary little person off her palm... and tosses him in her mouth. She swallowed hard and you had to assume where poor little Nathan went!

"W-W-W-WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!" you screamed off the top of your lungs as she plucked imagary people into her mouth one by one.

"Oh, didnt I tell you?" Jasmine asked, "the special hotel and beach resort is located in my stomach! That's how it's so secret!" She honestly said that. She's gonna eat you simply because she thinks her dream is THAT bizarre!
As she swallowed Wanda, you froze up with fear. Your only way to escape was to jump off her palm but it was a long way down and your fear of heights wasnt helping in this situation. Shame your instincts didnt register that you were about to experience a worse fate than the risk of falling to your death!

"Ok, that just leaves you [Hunter]," she picks your tiny little body from your palm and raises it toward her mouth, "I'll be sure to tell the staff to leave a mint on your pillow!"
"No no no no NONONONONO!!!!!!"
1223112132.title: It's just a dream, dream... NO IT'S A NIGHTMARE!

12232.content:
You have no context of who could be coming into this room, other than the obvious fact that they are going to be a lot taller than you, but you know that without their help, you'll be stuck here like this. Whether they're cruel or kind, you need to get their attention, and you'd preferably like to set up a spot to grab that precious attention before they get here.

Quickly surveying the enormous bedroom, you don't see many places where you can reach at your pathetically small stature - all the furniture seems mountainous to you, and climbing them would be both difficult and time-consuming. In fact, from your limited perspective, you can only see two worthwhile possibilities. The first is several Pokeballs strapped to a belt, lying on the floor near the titanic wardrobe, with each Pokeball about the size of a boulder. The second is a pair of brown sandals on the floor by the bed, both of which are bigger than your average car. The two possibilities remind you of just how small you are in this world.

Speaking of reminders about your tiny size, those footsteps are still getting closer, and the shockwaves are getting stronger. You swiftly decide on where to go to try and get the incoming giant's attention...

1312.content:
You slowly awaken and find yourself in what seems to be a desert. You look around in confusion, and you see nothing but sand stretching out towards the horizon in front of you. You turn around and look in the other direction to see an ocean, its waters rising and falling in huge waves at a faraway distance. There's not a cloud in the sky, and the sun is at its fullest and brightest today as it shines down on you, already making you warm and sweaty from the heat. You are at a loss - what exactly are you doing in a desert? Or is this just a very large beach? You're not entirely sure.

Your pondering is cut short as your senses, dull from sleep, start to return to their full potential and you realize that there's something else in this sandy expanse with you. To the north, away from the ocean and towards the endless sand, you...
1312.title: Brawly: The Big Wave

13122.content:
You are fairly certain the sight before you is impossible, but nonetheless, it is what you see - an enormous young man, terrifying large in size, stretched out before you on the sand as he seems to be tanning himself in the sun. His upper body is bare, revealing his tight muscles for all to see, while his lower body is merely a pair of swimming shorts. His hands are tucked underneath the back of his head as a makeshift pillow (though you have no doubt that they are as big and strong as the rest of the man) while his feet remain bare, radiating with warmth while granules of sand occasionally fall to earth as his toes instinctively wiggle in the summer breeze. The man's hair is an unusual shade of bright blue, and his eyes remain hidden to you - amber-lensed goggles block your view. For a moment, you are deathly afraid of alarming him, in case he is less than friendly, but his open mouth and his incessant snoring are a good sign that he is fast asleep.

Taking the time to adjust to the situation, you notice that the beach isn't empty, as several other giants pass around you, far in distance from your perspective but kicking up miniature sandstorms with each of their enormous steps. You know that this sleeping giant is your best chance for help, as opposed to trying in vain to get seen amongst the sand and probably ending up trampled for your efforts. Taking a few breaths to collect your courage, you head towards his...
13122.title: Brawly on the Beach

choices: Journey across her body to contact her.
Try something on her feet to get her attention.
Try and get away before she notices you.
1321.content:
You wake up and open your eyes, seeing nothing but blurry images. You rub your eyes to clear your vision, but when you blink the world still seems to swim before you. Confused, you get up and notice that you are on some rocks. You can make out a field of blue in the distance which you guess to be a lake of some kind. The air is heavy and warm and it makes you sweat. Wherever you are, it's so hot that it's practically steaming.

You finally realize why the world seems so blurry; there is steam everywhere.

Before you can try and examine where exactly you are, you hear a giggle from somewhere in the steam. It sounds feminine and fairly young, but you can't tell where it's coming from. You think of calling out for help but just before you do, there is a massive crashing sound of something hitting the water - something big. The water leaps up at the rocks you are on but thankfully they don't reach you. You look out at the 'lake' and the steam seems to clear, showing you what caused the enormous waves.

It's a woman - a giant woman, impossibly large in comparison to you. She has long fiery red hair, let down and now wet in the steaming water. She is garbed in a black bikini, with a flame symbol printed on her bra. Her skin is a dark warm tan and as she sighs, sinking into the warm water, her eyes open and you can see that they are just as bold and red as her hair. You figure that this is merely a steam bath for this giantess.

The huge woman sighs again, relaxing and sinking a little further in the water. She apparently doesn't know of your presence as she kicks her legs out and rests her feet on the edge of the bath, nearly slamming them on you. You flinch and fall backwards, now aware of how easy it would be for this woman to end your life - whether she's trying to or not. You spend a moment trying to calm yourself down and figure out what to do. You could try and contact her, either by making your way across her body or maybe taking advantage of the feet she has now planted next to you. Then again, of course, you don't know if she'll take kindly to you apparently spying on her while she bathes, so maybe it would be best to try and get away while you can?
1321.title: Flannery: The Fiery Passion

choices: Yes, she felt you in her sleep, and her hand comes in to scratch at you!
No, she's still fast asleep, and you continue your trek.
13211.content:
